Bites
Burns
Concussion

Laceration
Puncture

Tagalog

resources.string: "\t\tNot all of the procedures included in this application apply to all because of some uncontrollable factors like the current environment, location, materials that are needed and as well as the capabilities of the user. The developers or anyone else involved in the creation of this application will not be held liable and will not take any responsibility for the results of any attempt to use any of the presented information in this application."

string-array.name: spinner_options
string-array.item: Recommended Procedure
Alternative Procedure

string-array.name: animal_bites_practice
string-array.item: "Control the bleeding by applying pressure on the bite."
"Do not clean serious wound. It will be cleaned at a medical facility."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: insect_bites_practice
string-array.item: "Check if the bite mark or stinger is swelling and/or bleeding."
"Carefully remove the stinger using tweezers."
"Wash the wound with soap and water."
"Cover the area with clean bandage or gauze."
"Apply a cold pack to the affected area."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention if the person has trouble in breathing."

string-array.name: chemical_burns_practice
string-array.item: "Remove the victim's contaminated clothing while flushing it with water."
"Place the affected area under running water."
"Wash the affected area using mild soap before final rinse."
"Cover the burned area with a dry dressing."
"If the chemical is in the eye, flush it for at least 20 minutes using low-pressured water."
"Seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: third_deg_burns_practice
string-array.item: "Protect the burned person from further harm."
"Remove jeweleries, belts, and other restrictive items around the burned areas and the neck."
"Do not immerse large severe burns in cold water."
"If possible, raise the burned area above heart level"
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: concussion_practice
string-array.item: "Apply cold compress or cold pack to the injured area for 20 minutes every 3 hours."
"Observe your child carefully for the next 24 hours.
If there are any signs of internal injury, seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: contusion_practice
string-array.item: "Apply a cold pack, or ice wrapped in a clean towel, for up to 15 minutes on the bruise."
"If possible, keep the bruised area raised above the heart."
"Rest the bruised area."
"If needed, take pain reliever medicine to help reduce the pain."

string-array.name: fracture_practice
string-array.item: "In case of an open wound, control the bleeding and cover the wound with a sterile dressing."
"If a bone is protruding, use a ring pad then apply a bandage to immobilize the fractured part."
"Make sure that the bandage is not too tight."
"Support the fractured limb in the most comfortable position."
"Raise and rest a fractured foot or ankle on pillows or folded blankets."
"Immobilize the fractured part using a splint or sling. Do not try to straighten the fractured limb."
"Check regularly that the bandages are not too tight."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately in case of an open fracture or severe bleeding."

string-array.name: laceration_major_practice
string-array.item: "Put on disposable gloves."
"Stop the bleeding by firmly pressing the wound covered with gauze."
"Continue to monitor the person's condition."
"Care for shock. Keep the person from getting chilled or overheated."
"Have the person rest comfortable and provide reassurance."
"Wash your hands immediately after giving care, even if you wore gloves."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately if the bleeding doesn't stop."

string-array.name: laceration_minor_practice
string-array.item: "Use disposable gloves and place a sterile dressing on the wound."
"Apply direct pressure for a few minutes to control any bleeding."
"Wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water."
"Apply an antibiotic ointment to a minor wound if the person has no allergies to the medication."
"Cover the wound with a sterile dressing."

string-array.name: abrasion_recommended
string-array.item: "Wash the affected area with water and anti-bacterial soap."
"Apply povidone-iodine solution or spray on the wound."
"Cover the affected area with gauze or band-aid."
"Repeat daily until fully healed."

string-array.name: abrasion_alternative
string-array.item: "Boil the guava leaves in water and use it as a rinse to the affected area."
"Apply povidone-iodine solution or spray on the wound."
"Cover the affected area with gauze or clean handkerchief."
"Repeat daily until fully healed."

string-array.name: bites_animal_recommended
string-array.item: "Control the bleeding by applying pressure on the bite with a clean and dry cloth or handkerchief."
"Do not clean serious wound. It will be cleaned at a medical facility."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: bites_insect_recommended
string-array.item: "Check if the bite mark or stinger is swelling and/or bleeding."
"Carefully remove the stinger using tweezers."
"Wash the wound with soap and water."
"Cover the area with clean bandage or gauze."
"Apply a cold pack to the affected area."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention if the person has trouble in breathing."

string-array.name: bites_insect_alternative
string-array.item: "Check if the bite mark or stinger is swelling and/or bleeding."
"If there is a stinger, scrape it away using a flat surface, such as a credit card."
"Wash the wound with soap and water."
"Cover the area with a clean handkerchief or cloth."
"Apply ice cubes wrapped in a clean towel to the affected area to reduce pain and swelling."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention if the person has trouble in breathing."

string-array.name: burns_thermal_recommended
string-array.item: "Hold the burned area in running water for 5 to 10 minutes or until pain is relieved."
"Cover the burn with a dry, non-sticking, sterile dressing or a clean cloth."
"Keep the burned area clean by washing it with mild soap and water."

string-array.name: burns_chemical_recommended
string-array.item: "Remove the victim's contaminated clothing while flushing it with water."
"Place the burned area under running water."
"Wash the affected area using mild soap before final rinse."
"Cover the burned area with a dry dressing."
"If the chemical is in the eye, flush it for at least 20 minutes using low-pressured water."
"Seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: burns_electrical_recommended
string-array.item: "Unplug, disconnect, or turn off the power. If that is impossible, call the power company or ask for help."
"Seek medical attention immediately. Electrical injuries are treated in burn center."

string-array.name: burns_thermal_alternative
string-array.item: "Apply a clean towel dampened with a cool tap water to the burned area."
"Cover any small blisters with a loose bandage, or gauze, and tape."
"Keep the burned area clean by washing with mild soap and water."

string-array.name: burns_third_recommended
string-array.item: "Protect the burned person from further harm."
"Remove jeweleries, belts, and other restrictive items around the burned areas and the neck."
"Do not immerse large severe burns in cold water."
"Elevate the burned area. Raise the wound above heart level, if possible."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: burns_third_notes
string-array.item: "If you can do so safely, make sure the person you\'re helping is not in contact or exposed to smoke or heat. Do not remove burned clothing stuck to the skin."
"Burned areas swell rapidly."
"Doing so could cause a serious loss of body heat (hypothermia) or a drop in blood pressure and decreased blood flow (shock)."

string-array.name: burns_third_alternative
string-array.item: "Protect the burned person from further harm. If you can do so safely, make sure the person you\'re helping is not in contact or exposed to smoke or heat. Do not remove burned clothing stuck to the skin."
"Remove jeweleries, belts, and other restrictive items, especially from around the burned areas and the neck."
"Cover the burn with a dry, non-sticking, sterile dressing or a clean cloth."
"Treat the victim for shock by elevating the legs and keeping the victim warm with a clean sheet or blanket."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately."

string-array.name: concussion_recommended
string-array.item: "Apply cold compress or cold pack to the injured area for 20 minutes every 3 hours."
"Observe the victim for any signs of internal injury.
Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately if the victim is feeling nauseous or is vomiting."

string-array.name: contusion_recommended
string-array.item: "Apply a cold pack, or ice wrapped in a clean towel, for up to 15 minutes on the bruise to help reduce swelling."
"Keep the bruised area raised above the heart, if possible, to keep the blood from pooling in the bruised tissue."
"Try to rest the bruised part by not overworking the affected area."
"If needed, take pain reliever medicine to help reduce the pain."

string-array.name: fracture_recommended
string-array.item: "In case of an open wound, control the bleeding and cover the wound with a sterile dressing."
"If a bone is protruding, use a ring pad then apply a bandage to immobilize the fractured part."
"Make sure that the bandage is not too tight."
"Support the fractured limb in the most comfortable position."
"Raise and rest a fractured foot or ankle on pillows or folded blankets."
"Immobilize the fractured part using a splint or sling. Do not try to straighten the fractured limb."
"Check regularly that the bandages are not too tight."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately in case of an open fracture or severe bleeding."

string-array.name: laceration_major_recommended
string-array.item: "Put on disposable gloves. If you suspect that blood might splatter, you may need to wear eye and face protection."

"Control the bleeding by: 
(a) covering the wound with a dressing and firmly pressing against the wound until the bleeding stops or 
(b) applying a pressure bandage over the dressing to maintain pressure on the wound and to hold the dressing in place. 
If blood soaks through the bandage, do not remove the blood-soaked bandages. Instead, add more dressings and bandages and apply additional direct pressure."

"Continue to monitor the person's condition. Observe the person closely for signals that may indicate that the person's condition is worsening such as faster or slower breathing, changes in skin color and restlessness."
"Care for shock. Keep the person from getting chilled or overheated."
"Have the person rest comfortably."
"Wash your hands immediately after giving care, even if you wore gloves."
"Call 911 or seek medical attention immediately if the bleeding doesn't stop."

string-array.name: laceration_minor_recommended
string-array.item: "Wash your hands with soap and water.
"Use disposable gloves."
"Wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water."
"Apply direct pressure for a few minutes to control any bleeding."
"Apply an antibiotic ointment to a minor wound if the person has no known allergies or sensitivities to the medication."
"Cover the wound with a sterile dressing and a bandage or with an adhesive bandage to keep the wound moist and prevent drying."

string-array.name: laceration_minor_alternative
string-array.item: "Wash your hands with soap and water.
"Use any clean barrier between your hand and the wound if gloves is not available."
"Wash the wound thoroughly with soap and water."
"Apply direct pressure and press firmly against the wound. Use a clean cloth or handkerchief to apply pressure."
"Apply an antibiotic ointment to the wound if the person has no known allergies or sensitivities to the medication."
"Clean and cover the wound with a clean cloth or handkerchief."

string-array.name: puncture_severe_recommended
string-array.item: "Wash your hands with soap and water then wear gloves."
"Apply direct pressure to the affected area using a sterile gauze to control bleeding."
"Clean and cover the wound with a sterile gauze."
"Do not remove gauze if it's soaked with blood. Instead, apply additional gauze on top."
"Consult and refer to a physician immediately if the bleeding doesn't stop."

string-array.name: puncture_severe_alternative
string-array.item: "Wash your hands with soap and water. If gloves are not available, use any clean barrier between your hand and the wound."
"Apply direct pressure and press firmly against the wound. If sterile gauze is not available, use your hand or a clean cloth or handkerchief to apply pressure."
"Clean and cover the wound with a clean cloth or handkerchief."
"If the cloth becomes soaked with blood, do not remove it. Apply addition clean cloth on top."
"Consult and refer to a physician immediately if the bleeding doesn't stop."

string-array.name: puncture_slight_recommended
string-array.item: "Wash your hands with soap and water then wear gloves."
"Clean the wound with soap and water."
"Apply mild antiseptic on the wound."
"Cover the wound loosely with sterile gauze or bandage."

resources.string: "Drag the steps to arrange it according to the first aid procedure of "
"Tap the material to be used then tap the area where it should be applied."
"When the surface of a person’s skin comes in contact with a rough surface and this surface rubs the skin, exposing the surface skin or the uppermost layers of your epidermis."
"This happens when skin comes into contact with blunt or sharp edged objects such as rock, broken glass, knife or scissors."
"First and second degree burn happens when the skin or any part of the body comes into contact with flame, hot liquid or too much exposure to sun."

"Meanwhile, third degree burns are caused by a scalding liquid, skin that comes in contact with a hot object for an extended period of time, flames from a fire, an electrical source, a chemical source."

"Common causes includes fights, falls, playground injuries, car crashes, and bike accidents. Concussions can also happen while participating in any sport or activity such as football, boxing, hockey, soccer, skiing, or snowboarding."
"This is caused by trauma cases, such as a direct blow or applied force to the skin or body part."
"This is caused by traumatic incidents such as sporting injuries, vehicle accidents or falls."
"This is caused by forceful penetration of a sharp, pointed object through the skin."
"For insect bites, children who live near wooded and/or grassy or even dirty surrounding areas or who spend recreation time in these locations are most susceptible to insect bites."
"On the other hand, cats and dogs cause most animal bites. Children who have pets or who live in areas with these animals are more susceptible to animal bites."

string-array.name: abrasion_notes
string-array.item: Call your medical-care provider immediately for abrasion wounds longer than one-half inch that are gaping open and have edges that don’t stay together because as a rule, these wounds need stitches.
Never dress a wound with obvious contamination. If you aren’t able to get it clean, cover it lightly with a sterile bandage and seek medical attention.

string-array.name: insect_bites_notes
string-array.item: Don’t put petroleum jelly, alcohol, or ammonia on insect stuck on skin—they will make the insect bury deeper.
Watch for signs of itchiness, swelling on their face, hands or feet, slowing down of breathing. This symptoms requires medical attention immediately.

string-array.name: animal_bites_notes
string-array.item: Wild animals that gain access to your home pose a much more serious risk, as they are more likely to carry and transmit rabies and other viruses. These types of bites require immediate medical attention. The animal that has bitten the person needs to be monitored for rabies.

string-array.name: burns_thermal_notes
string-array.item: Immerse the burned area in cool water but not iced water.

Never apply adhesive dressings or any lotions, ointments or creams to a first or second degree burn that you are treating at home unless the skin is broken. Never apply grease, oil, ointment, toothpaste, or any other substance to any burn.

string-array.name: burns_chemical_notes
string-array.item: Immerse the burned area in cool water but not iced water.

Never apply adhesive dressings or any lotions, ointments or creams to a first or second degree burn that you are treating at home unless the skin is broken. Never apply grease, oil, ointment, toothpaste, or any other substance to any burn.

string-array.name: concussion_notes
string-array.item: In the case of bleeding under the scalp or bruises that are outside the skull known as “goose eggs,” use ice packs immediately in order to reduce swelling. Never apply ice directly to the skin.

string-array.name: contusion_notes
string-array.item: Never apply ice directly to the skin, use ice bag or cover the ice with a clean towel then apply it to the affected area.

string-array.name: fracture_notes
string-array.item: Do not touch or try to clean the wound; just fasten a sterile or clean pad or cloth securely in place over the wound and secure it with bandages or cloth strips (belts, scarves, neckties).
Do not move the injured person until a splint has been applied unless there is a greater danger of life-threatening urgency.

string-array.name: laceration_major_notes
string-array.item: Call your medical-care provider immediately for laceration wounds longer than one-half inch that are gaping open and have edges that don’t stay together because as a rule these wounds need stitches.

Never wash deep cuts, because it may increase the rate of bleeding. Do not remove blood-stained dressings from deep cuts, as this may restart bleeding. Never dress a wound with obvious contamination. If you are not able to get it clean, cover it lightly with a sterile bandage and seek medical attention.

See a doctor immediately if: (1) For cuts that do not stop bleeding after ten minutes or applying pressure. (2) If there is a chance that nerves or tendons have been affected. (3) If there is something embedded in the cut. (4) If the cut is on the mouth, face, hand, or genitals.

string-array.name: laceration_minor_notes
string-array.item: Never dress a wound with obvious contamination. If you are not able to get it clean, cover it lightly with a sterile bandage and seek medical attention.

string-array.name: puncture_severe_notes
string-array.item: Never wash a major or severe puncture wound as this may cause more serious bleeding.
Never probe or remove debris from a wound, attempt to push body parts back in, or breathe on a wound or dressing because doing so may cause serious infection later.

string-array.name: puncture_slight_notes
string-array.item: Never dress a wound with obvious contamination. If you are not able to get it clean, cover it lightly with a sterile bandage and seek medical attention.

resources.string: Interactive practice of first aid procedures has three stages: Selection of Materials, Arrangement of First Aid Steps and Application of First Aid.\n\nSelect an injury to start.
